SEARCH
Package file_manager.utils

Class PathUtils

java.lang.Object
file_manager.utils.PathUtils
public class PathUtils extends Object
Utility class for managing file system paths in the File Manager application.

This class provides static methods to:

  • Retrieve the current working directory
  • Change the current working directory to a specified path
  • Navigate to the parent directory

It supports both absolute and relative paths, and updates the "user.dir" system property to reflect changes in the working directory. Path validation is performed using Files and Path.

The class also interacts with DirectoryOperations for platform-specific path delimiters, and with InputUtils for user input when a path is not provided.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentWorkingDirectory

      public static String getCurrentWorkingDirectory()
      Retrieves the absolute path of the current working directory.
      Returns:
      the current working directory as a String

    • changeWorkingDirectory

      public static String changeWorkingDirectory(String targetDirectoryPath)
      Changes the current working directory to the specified path.

      If the provided path is null, the user is prompted to enter a path. The method supports both absolute and relative paths, and validates whether the target directory exists before updating the working directory.

      Parameters:
      targetDirectoryPath - the target directory path, or null to prompt the user
      Returns:
      the new working directory path if successful, or null if the operation fails

    • changeToParentDirectory

      public static void changeToParentDirectory()
      Changes the current working directory to its parent directory.

      If the current directory is already the root, this method does nothing.
